title: Arsenal vs Bournemouth Live : Arsenal vs Bournemouth : Is it Live on TV ? Check Prediction , head to head
body_text:
Arsenal will look to maintain their advantage over Manchester City in the Premier League as the gunners face Bournemouth this weekend. On Wednesday night, Arsenal put down another significant marker in the competitive fight for Premier League supremacy by crushing struggling Everton 4-0 in their game in hand to widen the distance at the top to five points.
By the time Arsenal plays again on Saturday afternoon, City may easily have cut that margin down to two points, but their midday matchup with Newcastle is not going to be easy.
In their quest for a fourth straight top-flight victory, Mikel Arteta's team would be well-positioned to capitalize on any additional errors at the Etihad, with their little early-February wobble now apparently firmly committed to history.
At the Emirates Stadium in north London, the game will be played.
Live Stream: Fans may view those highlights online on the BBC Sport website or BBC iPlayer.
Due to a major knee injury of his own, Mohamed Elneny is predicted to miss the remainder of the season, while Jorginho's availability is uncertain given this week's sickness.
After the victory over Everton, Arteta also disclosed that Eddie Nketiah had been struggling with a recent injury.
Bournemouth wins: 1
Draws: 2
Arsenal vs Bournemouth match odds
Arsenal to win: 1/5
Bournemouth to win: 13/1
Draw: 11/2

Date, kick-off time and venue
The kickoff for Arsenal vs. Bournemouth is set for Saturday, March 4, 2023, at 3 pm GMT.At the Emirates Stadium in north London, the game will be played.
Where to watch Arsenal vs Bournemouth
TV Channel: The game won't be shown live in the UK due to ongoing 3 pm blackout regulations in English football. However on Saturday night at 10:20 on BBC One, highlights may be seen on Match of the Day.Live Stream: Fans may view those highlights online on the BBC Sport website or BBC iPlayer.
Arsenal vs Bournemouth team news
Despite continuing to miss games for Arsenal, Gabriel Jesus is gradually increasing his workload after recuperating from knee surgery during the World Cup.Due to a major knee injury of his own, Mohamed Elneny is predicted to miss the remainder of the season, while Jorginho's availability is uncertain given this week's sickness.
After the victory over Everton, Arteta also disclosed that Eddie Nketiah had been struggling with a recent injury.

Arsenal to win, 3-0.Head to head (h2h) history and results
